Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

SudokuSolver

public SudokuSolver(java.lang.String puzzleName)
Create a solver given the name of a file containing a puzzle. We expect the file to contain nine lines each containing nine digits separated by whitespace. A digit from {1...9} represents a given value in the clue, and the digit 0 indicates a position that is blank in the initial puzzle.

Method Detail

backMove

public void backMove(int row,
                     int col)
Resets the values that are causing a conflict (i.e no value is being placed in this cell successfully without any same values in the same row, col, or region).

Parameters:
row - The row of the position
col - The column of the position

checkNumberInput

public boolean checkNumberInput(int row,
                                int col,
                                int newValue)
Checks if the value we want to insert causes an issue i.e. its duplicate is either present in the same row, col or region(mini-Array).

Parameters:
row - The row of the position
col - The column of the position
newValue - the value we want to check.
Returns:
true if there is no conflict (or false if there is a conflict)

display

public void display()
Pop up a window containing a nice representation of the original puzzle and out solution.

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
Run the solver. If args.length >= 1, use args[0] as the name of a file containing a puzzle, otherwise, allow the user to browse for a file.

print

public void print()
Print a character-based representation of the solution array on standard output.

solve

public boolean solve(int row,
                     int col)
Starting at a given grid position, generate values for all remaining grid positions that do not violate the game constraints.

Parameters:
row - The row of the position to begin with
col - The column of the position to begin with.
Returns:
true if a solution was found starting from this position, false if not.
